name: GCP
description: The main cloud provider we're using to host almost everything (for other stuff there's AWS)
column6: # The order of the entries is important: rings are displayed in the order of the _ring_ entries, so the first occurencies

name: GCP GKE
description: Hosting all Kubernetes projects, aside from Cawemo-related ones
column6: # of the _ring_ entries should be the following: Adopt, Trial, Assess, Hold

name: GCP CloudSQL
description: Hosting various databases, e.g. for Optimize or internal apps

name: GCP Storage
description: Used by a href="https://downloads.camunda.cloud">Download Center to store artifacts

name: AWS
description: Used to host Cawemo (SaaS), various databases (e.g. Aurora), and Aurora Jenkins job runners

name: AWS EC2
description: Cawemo clusters are defined with kops -> Terraform -> machines in EC2

name: AWS RDS
description: Hosting various databases, e.g. Cawemo stage and prod, Aurora MySQL and Postgres for running CamBPM integration tests

name: AWS ECS
description: Used to run CamBPM Jenkins jobs running integration tests against Aurora databases

name: AWS Lambda
description: Used by Cawemo for the thumbnail generator

name: GCP Data Studio
description: Building spending reports for GKE clusters.

name: GCP Big Query
description: Storing GKE usage data for camunda-ci cluster, used for spending reports

name: Terraform Cloud
description: GitOps for Terraform

name: AWS EKS
description: Can be a replacement for kops-defined k8s Cawemo clusters if the clusters stay in AWS.

name: ArgoCD
description: GitOps for Kubernetes cluster manifests.

name: Harbor
description: A Docker regsitry for Camunda images: registry.camunda.cloud

name: Download Center
description: Download center for Camunda products. repository

name: Nginx
description: We're using nginx-ingress as a reverse proxy for our k8s clusters, performing TLS termination and wrapping up authentication.

name: OpenLDAP
description: We host an LDAP replica of the main LDAP instance maintained by IT.

name: Vouch
description: Vouch is a SSO proxy for Nginx used by us to authenticate requests by Okta

name: Cert-manager
description: Automated provisioning of TLS certificates for k8s clusters: cert-manager

name: Gitlab CI/CD
description: Potential tool to enrich CI/CD offering to the other teams, which is currently limited by Jenkins

name: GitHub Actions
description: Potential tool to enrich CI/CD offering to the other teams, which is currently limited by Jenkins

name: Helm
description:
We've completely replaced Helm charts with Kustomize.
However, sometimes Helm charts are used as an upstream base for Kustomize projects.

name: Golang
description: Currently, only used in broken dashboard

name: Groovy
description: Groovy is used to define Jenkins jobs and pipelines. Example: jenkins-job-dsl-seed-jobs, jenkins-global-shared-library

name: Kubernetes
description: We're using k8s to host a wide range of applications, mainly our CI/CD tooling (Jenkins), internal apps, SaaS environments of Cawemo

name: Terraform
description: Used to define infrastructure as code, example: gcloud-infrastructure project.

name: Javascript
description: Used by the Download center for Camunda products. repository

name: Node.js
description: Used by the Download center for Camunda products. repository

name: kubeval
description: kubeval is used in gcloud-infrastructure project to check the validity of k8s manifests against the current and the next minor versions of the clusters.

name: CodeNarc
description: CodeNarc is used to check for common defects and bad practices in Groovy projects, e.g. jenkins-global-shared-library, jenkins-job-dsl-seed-jobs

name: Kustomize
description: Kustomize is a YAML templating tool to render k8s resources. Used in gcloud-infrastructure project.

name: terradiff
description: Can alert when Terraform code does not match state: terradiff

name: kops
description: Cawemo k8s clusters are defined with kops.
